mocafe.litforms.xu16¶

This module contains methods to build the weak form of a Phase Field cancer model described by Xu and collaborators [].

For a complete description of the model, please refer to the original publication. Also, if you use this model for your scientific work, remember to cite the original paper.

mocafe.litforms.xu16.xu2016_nutrient_form(sigma: dolfin.function.function.Function, sigma_0: dolfin.function.function.Function, c: dolfin.function.function.Function, phi: dolfin.function.function.Function, v: dolfin.function.argument.TestFunction, params: dict)¶

Equation describing the nutrient evolution in time based on the equation (6) of the paper by Xu et al. [].

The equation simply describes a general nutrient \(\sigma\) which diffuses from the capillaries field \(c\) and is consumed by the cancer and the healthy tissue (represented by value 1 and 0 of the field \(\varphi\):).

The parameters required for the equation must be specified in the parameters object. The name for the required parameters ore:

  • dt: the time step (time discretization: backward Euler)

  • D_sigma: diffusion constant for sigma (correspond to \(D_{\sigma}\) in the original paper)

  • V_pc: nutrient production rate at capillaries (correspond to \(V_{p}^{c}\) in the original paper)

  • V_uT: nutrient uptake rate by the tumor (correspond to \(V_{u}^{T}\) in the original paper)

  • V_uH: nutrient uptake rate by the healthy tissue (correspond to \(V_{u}^{H}\) in the original paper)

Parameters

  • sigma – the FEniCS Function for the nutrient

  • sigma_0 – the FEniCS Function for the nutrient initial value

  • c – the FEniCS Function for the capillaries

  • phi – the FEniCS Function for the cancer

  • v – the Test Function for the equation

  • params – the simulation parameters as Parameters object

Returns

the FEniCS UFL form of the equation

mocafe.litforms.xu16.xu_2016_cancer_form(phi: dolfin.function.function.Function, phi_0: dolfin.function.function.Function, sigma: dolfin.function.function.Function, v: dolfin.function.argument.TestFunction, params: mocafe.fenut.parameters.Parameters)¶

Equation describing cancer evolution according to equation (5) of the paper of Xu et al. [].

The equation describes a pretty versatile phase field cancer model based on a double well potential. The cancer is represented by the variable varphi.

The parameters required for the equation must be specified in the parameters object. The name for the required parameters ore:

  • dt: the time step (time discretization: backward Euler)

  • M_phi: mobility constant for varphi (correspond to \(M_{\phi}\) in the original paper)

  • lambda_phi: interface constant (correspond to \(\lambda_{phi}\) in the original paper)

  • sigma^(h-v): nutrient value separating the proliferative rim and the hypoxic rim (correspond to

\(\sigma^{h - v}\) in the original paper)

Parameters

  • phi – the FEniCS Function for the tumor

  • phi_0 – the FEniCS Function for the tumor initial condition

  • sigma – the FEniCS Function for the nutrient

  • v – Test Function for the equation

  • params – parameters of the equation

Returns

the FEniCS UFL form of the equation
